p: Passive transfer: An in vivo indirect protection assay was carried out as described previously [ 36]. Briefly, sera from immunized or naïve mice obtained during the direct protection experiment were mixed with PBS at a 1:1 ratio and heat-inactivated at 56 °С for 1 h. Then the sera were mixed 1:1 with rgH5N1 or Cal/09 virus, to reach the dose 3 × LD 50 and incubated at RT for 30 min. Naïve BALB/c mice were infected intranasally with a mixture of virus and sera at a volume of 50 µL and monitored for their survival rates and weight loss for 14 days post-infection ( Figure 1). Survival was defined as a 25% weight loss for the rgH5N1 virus and 30% for the Cal/09 virus.
